violent means.

the date of last consultation with the Hospital/Nursing Home where treatment was taken.

(b) Chronic condition - A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that has one or more of 
the following  characteristics;  
1. It needs ongoing or long -term monitoring through consultations, examinations, check -ups, and /or  
tests  
2. it needs ongoing or long -term control or relief of  symptoms  
3. it requires rehabilitation for the patient or for the patient to be specially trained to cope with  it 
4. it continues  indefinitely  
5. it recurs or is likely to  recur

external,  violent,  visible  and evident  means  which  is verified and certified by a Medical  Practitioner.

Intensive Care Unit: Intensive  care unit means  an identified  section,  ward  or wing of a hospital  which  is under  
the constant  supervision  of a dedicated  medical  practitioner(s),  and which  is specially  equipped  for the 
continuous  monitoring  and treatment  of patients  who are in a critical condition, or require life support facilities 
and where the level of care and supervision is considerably more sophisticated and intensive than in the 
ordinary and other  wards.  
ICU Charges: ICU (Intensive Care Unit) Charges means the amount charged by a Hospital towards ICU

patient  including  monitoring  devices, critical care nursing and intensivist
